intro: Isoetes ovata, commonly known as the ovate watermace, is a species of aquatic fern that belongs to the genus Isoetes. It is characterized by its spiny, leathery sheaths that enclose the spore-bearing structures called sporangia. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are usually narrow and elongated, with the sporangia clustered at the base of the leaf blades. Isoetes ovata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water filtration.
